message.content:
{"id": "131649", 
 "title": "Bug 131649: Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table", 
 "description": "When constructing an expression using a 2-level table to list offices and their employees, the designer generates an incorrect column reference expression. For example, an expression like `row[\"FIRSTNAME\"] + \" \" + row[\"LASTNAME\"] + \" / \" + row[\"OFFICECODE\"]` will not run properly. The user should be able to double click on the \"COUNTRY\" column and have the expression automatically insert `rows[0][\"COUNTRY\"]`. The index `0` refers to the 0-based index of the nested table containing the data set (0 for the outermost table, 1 for the first level inner table, etc.).", 
 "OB": "The designer generates an incorrect column reference expression for inner tables. For example, when constructing an expression using a 2-level table to list offices and their employees, the expression 'row[\"FIRSTNAME\"] + \" \" + row[\"LASTNAME\"] + \" / \" + row[\"OFFICECODE\"]' does not run properly.", 
 "EB": "When the user double clicks on the \"COUNTRY\" column, the expression should automatically insert 'rows[0][\"COUNTRY\"]'. The index '0' refers to the nested table containing the data set.", 
 "SR": "To reproduce the issue, open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). Double click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression. Click on \"Available Data Sets\", choose data set \"offices\", then double click on the \"COUNTRY\" column."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '131649', 'title': 'Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table', 'description': 'Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table This design uses a 2level table to list offices and their employees. So you can construct an expression like this:row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]However this report will not run. So the correct behavior when the user double clicks on "COUNTRY" is to insertrows[0]["COUNTRY"]into the expression.The first index (an integer) to the "rows" array is the 0based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first level inner table etc.). ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). To do this double click on the inner list\'s Data Item to edit its expression. Click on "Available Data Sets", choose data set "offices", then double click on column "COUNTRY". '}
